info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 21 at 2:12PM AKDT by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...BECOMING WET AND WINDY TONIGHT INTO LATE TUESDAY... Southeast Alaska should ready for periods of heavy rain and wind through mid-week. A strong storm approaches the Panhandle from the south tonight. This storm arrives with strong winds, heavy rainfall, and higher elevation snow late Monday night into Tuesday. Rainfall totals from late Monday afternoon through late Tuesday night range from 1 to 2 inches from Angoon northward including Juneau. For areas south of Angoon, including Sitka, Petersburg, Wrangell, Prince of Wales Island, and Ketchikan, expect 1 to 3 inches. Windy conditions will develop in particular along the coast where gusts of 40 mph will develop early Tuesday and persist through the day. Inner Channel communities will also be very breezy Tuesday as well.
